verses.kjv: And the men of Ephraim said unto him, Why hast thou served us thus, that thou calledst us not, when thou wentest to fight with the Midianites? And they did chide with him sharply.
verses.web: The men of Ephraim said to him, “Why have you treated us this way, that you didn’t call us when you went to fight with Midian?” They rebuked him sharply.
verses.ct: The men of Ephraim confronted Gideon angrily. "Why did you treat us like this?" they demanded. "You didn't even call us when you went to fight the Midianites!" They argued with him fiercely.

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, What have I done now in comparison of you? Is not the gleaning of the grapes of Ephraim better than the vintage of Abiezer?
verses.web: He said to them, “What have I now done in comparison with you? Isn’t the gleaning of the grapes of Ephraim better than the vintage of Abiezer?
verses.ct: Gideon replied, "What have I accomplished compared to you? Even the leftover grapes of Ephraim are worth more than the entire harvest of Abiezer!"

verses.kjv: God hath delivered into your hands the princes of Midian, Oreb and Zeeb: and what was I able to do in comparison of you? Then their anger was abated toward him, when he had said that.
verses.web: God has delivered into your hand the princes of Midian, Oreb and Zeeb! What was I able to do in comparison with you?” Then their anger was abated toward him when he had said that.
verses.ct: "God handed the Midianite commanders Oreb and Zeeb over to you! What did I do that even comes close to that?" When they heard this, their anger cooled down.

verses.kjv: And Gideon came to Jordan, and passed over, he, and the three hundred men that were with him, faint, yet pursuing them.
verses.web: Gideon came to the Jordan and passed over, he and the three hundred men who were with him, faint, yet pursuing.
verses.ct: Gideon and his 300 men crossed the Jordan River. They were exhausted but still chasing the enemy.

verses.kjv: And he said unto the men of Succoth, Give, I pray you, loaves of bread unto the people that follow me; for they be faint, and I am pursuing after Zebah and Zalmunna, kings of Midian.
verses.web: He said to the men of Succoth, “Please give loaves of bread to the people who follow me; for they are faint, and I am pursuing after Zebah and Zalmunna, the kings of Midian.”
verses.ct: He said to the people of Succoth, "Please give my men some bread. They're worn out, and I'm still pursuing Zebah and Zalmunna, the kings of Midian."

verses.kjv: And the princes of Succoth said, Are the hands of Zebah and Zalmunna now in thine hand, that we should give bread unto thine army?
verses.web: The princes of Succoth said, “Are the hands of Zebah and Zalmunna now in your hand, that we should give bread to your army?”
verses.ct: But the leaders of Succoth shot back, "Have you already captured Zebah and Zalmunna? Why should we feed your army before you've won?"

verses.kjv: And Gideon said, Therefore when the LORD hath delivered Zebah and Zalmunna into mine hand, then I will tear your flesh with the thorns of the wilderness and with briers.
verses.web: Gideon said, “Therefore when LORD has delivered Zebah and Zalmunna into my hand, then I will tear your flesh with the thorns of the wilderness and with briers.”
verses.ct: Gideon answered, "Fine. When the LORD hands Zebah and Zalmunna over to me, I'll come back and drag your bodies through desert thorns and briers."

verses.kjv: And he went up thence to Penuel, and spake unto them likewise: and the men of Penuel answered him as the men of Succoth had answered him.
verses.web: He went up there to Penuel, and spoke to them in the same way; and the men of Penuel answered him as the men of Succoth had answered.
verses.ct: From there he went to Penuel and made the same request. The men of Penuel gave him the same answer the men of Succoth had.

verses.kjv: And he spake also unto the men of Penuel, saying, When I come again in peace, I will break down this tower.
verses.web: He spoke also to the men of Penuel, saying, “When I come again in peace, I will break down this tower.”
verses.ct: So he told the men of Penuel, "When I return victorious, I will tear down this tower."

verses.kjv: Now Zebah and Zalmunna were in Karkor, and their hosts with them, about fifteen thousand men, all that were left of all the hosts of the children of the east: for there fell an hundred and twenty thousand men that drew sword.
verses.web: Now Zebah and Zalmunna were in Karkor, and their armies with them, about fifteen thousand men, all who were left of all the army of the children of the east; for there fell one hundred twenty thousand men who drew sword.
verses.ct: Zebah and Zalmunna were camped at Karkor with about 15,000 soldiers — all that remained of the eastern armies. 120,000 fighting men had already fallen in battle.

verses.kjv: And Gideon went up by the way of them that dwelt in tents on the east of Nobah and Jogbehah, and smote the host: for the host was secure.
verses.web: Gideon went up by the way of those who lived in tents on the east of Nobah and Jogbehah, and struck the army; for the army felt secure.
verses.ct: Gideon took a route along the nomad trail east of Nobah and Jogbehah and attacked the army while they felt safe and weren't expecting it.

verses.kjv: And when Zebah and Zalmunna fled, he pursued after them, and took the two kings of Midian, Zebah and Zalmunna, and discomfited all the host.
verses.web: Zebah and Zalmunna fled and he pursued them. He took the two kings of Midian, Zebah and Zalmunna, and confused all the army.
verses.ct: Zebah and Zalmunna tried to escape, but Gideon chased them down and captured both Midianite kings, throwing their entire army into chaos.

verses.kjv: And Gideon the son of Joash returned from battle before the sun was up,
verses.web: Gideon the son of Joash returned from the battle from the ascent of Heres.
verses.ct: Gideon son of Joash returned from the battle by way of the pass of Heres.

verses.kjv: And caught a young man of the men of Succoth, and enquired of him: and he described unto him the princes of Succoth, and the elders thereof, even threescore and seventeen men.
verses.web: He caught a young man of the men of Succoth, and inquired of him; and he described for him the princes of Succoth, and its elders, seventy-seven men.
verses.ct: He captured a young man from Succoth and questioned him. The young man wrote down the names of Succoth's leaders and elders for him — 77 men in all.

verses.kjv: And he came unto the men of Succoth, and said, Behold Zebah and Zalmunna, with whom ye did upbraid me, saying, Are the hands of Zebah and Zalmunna now in thine hand, that we should give bread unto thy men that are weary?
verses.web: He came to the men of Succoth, and said, “See Zebah and Zalmunna, concerning whom you taunted me, saying, ‘Are the hands of Zebah and Zalmunna now in your hand, that we should give bread to your men who are weary?’ ”
verses.ct: Then Gideon went to the men of Succoth and said, "Remember Zebah and Zalmunna? You mocked me, saying, 'Have you already captured Zebah and Zalmunna? Why should we feed your exhausted men?'"

verses.kjv: And he took the elders of the city, and thorns of the wilderness and briers, and with them he taught the men of Succoth.
verses.web: He took the elders of the city, and thorns of the wilderness and briers, and with them he taught the men of Succoth.
verses.ct: He seized the elders of the city, and with desert thorns and briers he punished the men of Succoth.

verses.kjv: And he beat down the tower of Penuel, and slew the men of the city.
verses.web: He broke down the tower of Penuel, and killed the men of the city.
verses.ct: He also tore down the tower of Penuel and killed the men of that city.

verses.kjv: Then said he unto Zebah and Zalmunna, What manner of men were they whom ye slew at Tabor? And they answered, As thou art, so were they; each one resembled the children of a king.
verses.web: Then he said to Zebah and Zalmunna, “What kind of men were they whom you killed at Tabor?” They answered, “They were like you. They all resembled the children of a king.”
verses.ct: Then he turned to Zebah and Zalmunna and asked, "The men you killed at Tabor — what did they look like?" They answered, "They looked just like you. Every one of them could have passed for a king's son."

verses.kjv: And he said, They were my brethren, even the sons of my mother: as the LORD liveth, if ye had saved them alive, I would not slay you.
verses.web: He said, “They were my brothers, the sons of my mother. As LORD lives, if you had saved them alive, I would not kill you.”
verses.ct: Gideon's face hardened. "Those were my brothers — my own mother's sons. As surely as the LORD lives, if you had let them live, I wouldn't kill you now."

verses.kjv: And he said unto Jether his firstborn, Up, and slay them. But the youth drew not his sword: for he feared, because he was yet a youth.
verses.web: He said to Jether his firstborn, “Get up and kill them!” But the youth didn’t draw his sword; for he was afraid, because he was yet a youth.
verses.ct: He turned to his oldest son Jether and said, "Get up and kill them!" But the boy didn't draw his sword — he was too afraid, because he was still young.

verses.kjv: Then Zebah and Zalmunna said, Rise thou, and fall upon us: for as the man is, so is his strength. And Gideon arose, and slew Zebah and Zalmunna, and took away the ornaments that were on their camels’ necks.
verses.web: Then Zebah and Zalmunna said, “You rise and fall on us; for as the man is, so is his strength.” Gideon arose, and killed Zebah and Zalmunna, and took the crescents that were on their camels’ necks.
verses.ct: Zebah and Zalmunna said to Gideon, "Do it yourself. A task like this calls for a man's strength." So Gideon stood up and killed Zebah and Zalmunna, then took the crescent-shaped ornaments from their camels' necks.

verses.kjv: Then the men of Israel said unto Gideon, Rule thou over us, both thou, and thy son, and thy son’s son also: for thou hast delivered us from the hand of Midian.
verses.web: Then the men of Israel said to Gideon, “Rule over us, both you, your son, and your son’s son also; for you have saved us out of the hand of Midian.”
verses.ct: After this, the men of Israel said to Gideon, "Rule over us — you, your son, and your grandson after him. You saved us from Midian!"

verses.kjv: And Gideon said unto them, I will not rule over you, neither shall my son rule over you: the LORD shall rule over you.
verses.web: Gideon said to them, “I will not rule over you, neither shall my son rule over you. LORD shall rule over you.”
verses.ct: But Gideon told them, "I won't rule over you, and my son won't rule over you either. The LORD will rule over you."

verses.kjv: And Gideon said unto them, I would desire a request of you, that ye would give me every man the earrings of his prey. (For they had golden earrings, because they were Ishmaelites.)
verses.web: Gideon said to them, “I do have a request: that you would each give me the earrings of his plunder.” (For they had golden earrings, because they were Ishmaelites.)
verses.ct: Then Gideon added, "I do have one request: each of you give me one gold earring from the plunder you took." (The defeated enemy wore gold earrings because they were Ishmaelites.)

verses.kjv: And they answered, We will willingly give them. And they spread a garment, and did cast therein every man the earrings of his prey.
verses.web: They answered, “We will willingly give them.” They spread a garment, and every man threw the earrings of his plunder into it.
verses.ct: "Gladly!" they replied. They spread out a garment on the ground, and each man tossed in a gold earring from his share of the plunder.

verses.kjv: And the weight of the golden earrings that he requested was a thousand and seven hundred shekels of gold; beside ornaments, and collars, and purple raiment that was on the kings of Midian, and beside the chains that were about their camels’ necks.
verses.web: The weight of the golden earrings that he requested was one thousand and seven hundred shekels of gold, in addition to the crescents, and the pendants, and the purple clothing that was on the kings of Midian, and in addition to the chains that were about their camels’ necks.
verses.ct: The gold earrings alone weighed 1,700 shekels — and that didn't include the crescent ornaments, pendants, purple robes taken from the Midianite kings, or the chains from their camels' necks.

verses.kjv: And Gideon made an ephod thereof, and put it in his city, even in Ophrah: and all Israel went thither a whoring after it: which thing became a snare unto Gideon, and to his house.
verses.web: Gideon made an ephod out of it, and put it in Ophrah, his city. Then all Israel played the prostitute with it there; and it became a snare to Gideon and to his house.
verses.ct: Gideon used the gold to make an ephod and displayed it in his hometown of Ophrah. But all Israel began worshiping it there like an idol, and it became a trap for Gideon and his entire family.

verses.kjv: Thus was Midian subdued before the children of Israel, so that they lifted up their heads no more. And the country was in quietness forty years in the days of Gideon.
verses.web: So Midian was subdued before the children of Israel, and they lifted up their heads no more. The land had rest forty years in the days of Gideon.
verses.ct: Midian was completely defeated by the Israelites and never rose to power again. The land enjoyed peace for 40 years during Gideon's lifetime.

verses.kjv: And Jerubbaal the son of Joash went and dwelt in his own house.
verses.web: Jerubbaal the son of Joash went and lived in his own house.
verses.ct: Jerubbaal — that is, Gideon son of Joash — went home and settled down.

verses.kjv: And Gideon had threescore and ten sons of his body begotten: for he had many wives.
verses.web: Gideon had seventy sons conceived from his body, for he had many wives.
verses.ct: Gideon fathered 70 sons, because he had many wives.

verses.kjv: And his concubine that was in Shechem, she also bare him a son, whose name he called Abimelech.
verses.web: His concubine who was in Shechem also bore him a son, and he named him Abimelech.
verses.ct: He also had a concubine living in Shechem, and she bore him a son he named Abimelech.

verses.kjv: And Gideon the son of Joash died in a good old age, and was buried in the sepulchre of Joash his father, in Ophrah of the Abiezrites.
verses.web: Gideon the son of Joash died in a good old age, and was buried in the tomb of Joash his father, in Ophrah of the Abiezrites.
verses.ct: Gideon son of Joash died at a ripe old age and was buried in his father Joash's tomb in Ophrah, the town of the Abiezrites.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as soon as Gideon was dead, that the children of Israel turned again, and went a whoring after Baalim, and made Baalberith their god.
verses.web: As soon as Gideon was dead, the children of Israel turned again and played the prostitute following the Baals, and made Baal Berith their god.
verses.ct: As soon as Gideon died, the Israelites went right back to chasing after the Baals, making Baal Berith their god.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel remembered not the LORD their God, who had delivered them out of the hands of all their enemies on every side:
verses.web: The children of Israel didn’t remember LORD their God, who had delivered them out of the hand of all their enemies on every side;
verses.ct: The Israelites forgot the LORD their God, who had rescued them from every enemy that surrounded them.

verses.kjv: Neither shewed they kindness to the house of Jerubbaal, namely, Gideon, according to all the goodness which he had shewed unto Israel.
verses.web: neither did they show kindness to the house of Jerubbaal, that is, Gideon, according to all the goodness which he had shown to Israel.
verses.ct: They also showed no loyalty to the family of Jerubbaal — that is, Gideon — despite all the good he had done for Israel.
